description:
You are a group of film screenwriters working in the era of the increasingly large film industry. In the next year, your job is to be the most productive screenwriter like the producer wants. At the end of every quarter of the year, you will face a producer to earn your income. However, writing is not an easy job, so you have to help each other and deal to find the right words of inspiration. Earning a lot of money may not necessarily be the road to your success because at the end of the year it's the most important reputation in the industry that determines your victory.

In Cine Write and Trade, players will: Write words... Sell words... Buy words... and Guess Words...

In the process, players will write words then sell it to another player, so every player will buy and sell words from each others. This process will build deductions and create sense of progression so finally every player can guess another players secret words. Player with most reputation point will be the winner of the game.

Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2020 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The Vehicle Rush deck includes  white, black, and red energies. It focuses on vehicles, making it slightly more complex to play than the other Challenger Decks in the 2020 series

Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2020 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The Second Sun Control deck includes white and blue energies. In the tradition of Control decks, it focuses on negating the main maneuvers of the opponent in order to win the game in the long run.

Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2019 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
This deck includes red and blue energies. In the tradition of Tempo decks, it focuses on disrupting the tempo of the opponent, forcing them to use their mana inefficiently.

In Sorrow! Death of a King, the King has died and all the Kings men struggle to empty out the Royal Treasury first and to become the new ruler of this medieval Kingdom. You play cards to represent your court supporters and Archer mercenaries as you struggle against your opponents to rule the court and gain the most money by whatever means from the dead King's treasury and to purchase the support needed to become the next ruler of the land.

Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology is, as the name suggests, an anthology of roll-and-write games in book form, specifically ten different games from eleven designers for a range of player counts and complexity levels. The games range from charting the stars and regaling one another with the mythology that surrounds the constellations, to building and protecting coral reefs, to portraying nature taking over an abandoned city.

To play the games, you need to provide your own writing implements and dice, specifically a half-dozen six-sided dice in one color, another half-dozen six-sided dice in another color, a six-sided die in a third color, and a four-sided, eight-sided, and ten-sided die.

ã„ã‚ã‹ã‚‹ãŸ (Color Karuta) is a color-building game in which players take transparent cards in five colors (CMYK and white) and overlay them in an attempt to recreate a color presented to them by an opponent or a color on an object in real life. The order in which you stack the cards matters, so build with care!

The game includes Ukiyo-e postcards that can serve as targets to match in color should you not have anything else appropriate within reach.
user summary

This is a game to create colors by combining transparent color cards.
é€ã‘ã‚‹è‰²ã‚«ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’çµ„ã¿åˆã‚ã›ã¦è‰²ã‚’ã¤ãã£ã¦éŠã¶ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ 
publisher's summary

Based on the famous cartoon hero Sport Billy, this is a simple roll the dice and move vintage board game. It was made in Greece from Stam Toys toy company, probably in the early 80's.

It can be played from 2-4 players. The winner is the first player who reaches endpoint by the exact number. There are some spaces on the board, with different symbols upon them. When you reach a space with a symbol of a dice you can play again. The blue circle symbol means that you have to go 6 spaces backwards, the yellow circle means that you lose your turn. Moreover, when you reach a space with a blue star upon it, you move 4 spaces forward and you can play one more time. When you reach a space with a red star upon it, you must go back in the beginning.

—user summary

“The war didn’t make sense anymore. We all thought it was bullshit. We weren’t solving anything, we weren’t helping to win the war. We were just there, and it basically came down to staying alive and keeping your buddies alive.” –Pfc. Edward W. Voros, Company A, 46th Infantry, Americal Division, March 1971.

For most Americans, by the Spring of 1971, the “light at the end of tunnel” that had become the War in Vietnam was in sight. Peace talks were well underway in Paris, as was “Vietnamization’; President Nixon’s official policy for turning over the bulk of the war effort and fighting to the forces of the ARVN (Army of the Republic of [South] Vietnam). As part of the transition the 23rd US Infantry Division, the “Americal”, was due to be rotated out of fighting and turning over its positions to ARVN’s First Corp. The Americal had earned a bad reputation two years earlier at My Lai, and the division was subjected to a complete review and re-organization following that atrocity. The higher-ups decreed there would be no more “screw ups” by this unit while it served out its remaining time “in country.”

One of the most remote American positions was Fire Base Mary Ann, not far from Chu Lai, occupied by elements of the 46th Regiment of the Americal Division. By the last week of March an ARVN artillery battery had already moved in and the base was to be completely turned-over in early April. However, the local Viet Cong (Communist South Vietnamese) commander saw a growing opportunity during the transition to strike a final blow against the Imperialist forces of the US. Deploying the elite 409th Sapper Battalion for the attack, the Communist’s “parting shot” was to remind both the US and ARVN that the war was far from over.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

—description from the designer

You and your fellow compatriots are all on your way to becoming famous pie making Cheflebrities! You have all been selected for a contest competing with each other in the kitchen to build the best quality pies as you possibly can!

Blue Ribbon Pie is a fun, casual, family card game! You take turns drawing cards from the ingredients pile, playing a card on your turn, and putting together the best quality pies you can! But watch out, mistakes can be made and people can sabotage each other in the kitchen with special cards. Points are tallied up at the end based on quality and special conditions to find out who the winner is!

—description from the designer

Angel Investor is a deck-building game for 2 to 4 players. Players are investors competing to become the most famous before they run out of money. The game is presented as a satire on silicon-valley start-up culture with card art that depicts anthropomorphic animals taking part in exaggerated acts of office politics.

It features unique deck-building mechanics where all players modify cards in every "start-up" deck. It was designed by an artificial intelligence consulting company using their algorithms to optimize balance through simulation and boasts a simultaneously chaotic and high skill game as a result.

—description from the designer

In deep dark we live. It cold, it damp, but home to fancy emerald, yummy worms, and other lovely shiny bits. Big Boss say first goblin who collect set of shiny bits is BEST goblin. All goblin want help Big Boss. Me know goblin secret though. Best goblin always get what Big Boss want, because best goblin always cheat!

Goblin Teeth is a dice game for 2-5 players. You play as a goblin, bidding on valuable goblin items with goblin dice and using goblin Cheat cards from your goblin hand to gain advantages over the other goblin players. The round ends when everyone has placed all of their dice; each Item is awarded to the goblin who bid the most for it. Be the first to complete an Offering for the Big Boss to win!

If, at the end of a round, a player has acquired all of the Items to complete any one of the 3 Offering cards (6-Item, A, or B), the game ends and they win!

In Sweet Pietyyy, players are residents of a small village and are trying to prevent "vamPIEre" from eating their desserts. Each player will have a different eating pattern according to their identity, and the goal of the game is to hold pie parties around the clock to deduct which team each player belongs to. If his eating times line up in a cross on the clock, then he might be a vamPIEre! A light and innovative social deduction game for 4-8 players that can be played within 20 minutes.

You play as a lone barbarian in a land of trees, sand, and mountains.  You are on a mission to reclaim your throne from a conniving usurper, but you must travel through the unforgiving lands of danger and peril.  Use and carefully upgrade your skills as you travel.  By the time this month passes, when the moon has gone through its phases, it will be too late.

Players hold all the cards needed to play in their hand.  Taking into account the player's skill value in addition to the values on the cards, each event on the cards will have a level of difficulty.  Beat that difficulty, and the player succeeds!  Fail and the repercussions could be loss of health, water, gold or be forced to retreat.  Hex by hex, the player makes their way back to the city where the throne awaits!

Deeply inspired by the 1981 game Barbarian Prince, I've made this game in an attempt to capture the fun and excitement of exploration, adventure, and wilderness-living; while avoiding a dense book of tables and the somewhat arbitrary nature of the classic 1981 game.  All the wonder of exploration, condensed into a mint tin, with only cards, paperclips, and the player's sense of adventure!

—description from the publisher

Science is cool, and this brilliant BrainBox Science covers important topics taught to children aged seven to eleven, from life cycles to light, healthy plants to the human body, magnets to materials. This game has been developed by an experienced primary school science teacher, is suitable for all ability levels and is great fun!

Brainbox is an innovative Memory Recall game. It consists of picture cards, with questions on the reverse. Players are given 10 seconds to look at the picture, and then try and answer questions on the reverse of the card.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Brainbox Science is ideally suited to kids aged 8 and up. It makes a fantastic family game, and can be easily taken on evenings out, or family holidays!

Shady Pets is a highly strategic card game that requires you to play in a most shady way as you strive to correctly guess the identity of the mystery pets. It's a little like Clue, Uno and Exploding Kittens. You have to steal, take, show, sneak peak, expose, ambush, stop other players, grab and even throw an occasional octopus at an opponent on your way to victory.

As players take turns, the game gets more intense because, just like you, everyone is getting closer to solving the mystery pets, yet who is going play the best game, collect the most points and win the game?

We think Shady Pets has all the elements that make games popular. It makes players laugh with its clever sayings and endearing artwork. It presents multiple levels of strategic play that will test your memory and deduction skills. You get to attack your opponents (in the most unusual way) and you get rewarded for taking chances!

—description from the designer

Droplets is an abstract, strategic placement, area control, chain reaction game, in which you play droplets of water onto the board. As droplets accumulate in a space, they can trigger a splash, causing all the droplets within to move outwards. These can, in turn, cause other splashes to be triggered – though not always under your control, and not always for your benefit.
Your goal is to splash your droplets onto the fountains around the board, while sending your opponents’ down the drain.

—description from the designer

This game is about you been the first to find the pirate treasure.
You need to collect the 3 objects: the map, a key and the compass.
Then you need to go to one of the three island to return the treasure card and find the treasure (the 2 others been empty and with the pirate) before the pirate reach the top of the dedicated scale.

Each turn, the player have to roll a dice, and move accordingly on the board.
Depending on where you finish your move, you may collect:

     one of the needed object
     Relaunch the dice
     Move the main pirate

Hybrords is a simple, card-based party-style game of portmanteau, in which players creatively combine words to create new words, called hybrords (hybrid words). Players then invent funny or clever definitions for their hybrord, and "sell" it to the judge as creatively as possible. The judge selects not only the round winner, but also the rules to be used for that round. Add to other players' hybrords/definitions, and potentially earn assists!

The fun even continues after the game is over, since players will be using these hybrords in conversation for the rest of the night, and even beyond! With an official Hybrords dictionary, fans can even share their creativity with the rest of the Hybrords community!

With so much riding on players' own creativity, it's the game that's only as fun as you are! But with all of the laughs to be had, there really are no losers in Hybrords!

—description from the publisher

However you like to get around, this BrainBox is for you. From a camel to a canoe, a glider to a go-kart, a milk float to a monster truck, this brilliant BrainBox travels by land, air and sea for fantastic family fun. All aboard!

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

BrainBox First Letters is designed to give pre-school children a head start. Each sturdy double- sided card shows three images with their initial letters on one side and just the images on the other, with the question, “What letter?”. The object of the game is to look at and talk about a card, then turn it over and try to remember the initial letter of each image. If the letters are named correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Take BrainBox to a whole new level with the BrainBox Board Game!

Lift the lid off the box to make the playing board magically appear, then move around the board collecting cards from each of eight subject categories, including Food and Drink, People and Places and Entertainment.

Special squares allow you to pick your own subject category, battle against another player or gamble the cards you hold already in order to win the game.

Rolling Stone is a rock & roll music game for anyone who has ever heard a song. You don't have to be a music buff to win this game; you just need to know the names of some very famous bands and have heard a famous song or two.

To start, a player from each team competes in the Music Buzzer Battle. The winner of this round takes an advantage into Round 2: Triple Charades Jeopardy. Here, players try to get their team to guess the artist by describing them in one of three ways: quoting lyrics, humming or using one word. The first team to collect a disc from all eight genres wins.

—description from the publisher

A fine and sunny day, and the fields are in bloom! The bumblebees are hungry, if a bit short-sighted, and need your help to visit as many flowers as possible. With just a single sheet and a pen, can you guide them through the fields?

Bumbling Bees is a fold-and-write game for a single player, requiring nothing more than a printed sheet of paper, a pair of scissors, and a pen. The current time creates a unique setup condition so no two games are the same. Throughout the game, you will begin to fold your game sheet over on itself, concealing portions of the playing field and creating new opportunities. For fans of roll-and-write games, this offers a similar one-page puzzle experience without the dice.

It is a dark time for the Mortals. Creatures have driven them from their cabins in Camp Murkwood and pursued them all the way to the Forbidden Island.

Evading the dreaded onslaught, a group of fighters led by no one has begun to resist these creature threats with weapons stolen from the mad scientist armory.

These scientists, obsessed with their next great creation, have dispatched creatures to continue the hunt. But this time, the Mortals plan to fight back...

Revenge of the Mortals is a stand alone game in the Campy-verse where players will take on the roles of different Mortals facing 8 rounds of Creature attacks. Armed with unique weapons, players will need to form squads to combat these creatures, and lucky for you, your party of friends are here to help. But in the end, there can be only one hero of the story.

Your goal, in Revenge, is to score the most valuable Relics and Treasures by defeating Creatures. Revenge of the Mortals is played over the course of eight rounds. Every round a new Creature threat is drawn and each player will play a Weapon card from their hand in an attempt to survive the threat and possibly score some sweet Loot. Players can work together as a squad to overcome these threats or turn on each other in order to score more points. Players will negotiate, and then play a card from their hand face-down in front of them. Once everyone has chosen or The Sands of Time has run out (in which case a card must be selected randomly), each player reveals their chosen card simultaneously. Players will either survive the threat or lose Health. Can you survive the night?

—description from the publisher

Take on the role of the girl and the robot as you battle the evil queen in this strategic card game inspired by concepts from Russian roulette and classic shedding card games.

Plan strategies with your ally, deceive your opponents and play cards at key moments to avoid death by the demon.

Basic Gameplay:

     Each player takes turns one after the other.
     Draw a card at the end of your turn, if it’s a Demon, you’re dead.
     When you play in teams, if both you and your ally die, you lose the game.
     To prevent this from happening, use your character’s Abilities, play Action and Weapon cards during your turn.


—description from the publisher

Codenames: The Simpsons combines the hit social word game Codenames, while featuring characters and locations from thirty years of The Simpsons.

In Codenames, two teams — Team Homer and Team Bart — compete to see who can guess all of their "field agents" (identified by either a word or picture) correctly first — but those field agents are hiding in plain sight in a 5x5 grid that includes the agents of the other team, neutral words, and an assassin that will cause you to lose the game immediately if you guess it. One person on each team is a spymaster and only these two know which agents belong to each team. Spymasters take turns giving one-word clues that can help their teammates identify multiple agents on the board. Their teammates try to guess agents of the right color while avoiding those that belong to the opposing team — and everyone wants to avoid the assassin.

To master the Guilds, you must first master the shadows. You ply your trade lurking in the depths of the city, while committing unspeakable skulduggery and, all the while, developing your dark arts and spell craft. Direct confrontation is not your preference; however, there will be times you must fight to advance through the challenges, quests and battles that lay ahead. All you need to do is advance 11 Levels, through 11 increasing Guilds, while engaging in 22 different Quests and acquiring up to 15 different Skills and Spells. Sound like a lot to track? Nonsense! It is all contained on ONE page.  You roll. You write.  Hopefully, you advance . . . or at least live to fight another day . . . which for us humble few, is all we ask.  This takes the One Page In A Life Series (OPIAL Series) further into the Fantasy Realm.

Components:
1 Character Page (actually, this is entire game . . . except for the dice . . . oh, and a pen or pencil)
4 Red Dice (Combat Dice)
4 Blue Dice (Magic Dice)
4 Green Dice (Nature Dice)

Harter Tobak is a German card game by Simon & Jan where you have to fill in the blanks and build card combinations.
The standard version of it launched in 2014,  the Mobbing Edition. In the end of 2018 the Mobbing Edition has been released.

The 2014 version was very comparable to cards against humanity individualized by a whole bunch of special cards that changed the game mechanisms mid-game.

The so called Mobbing Edition from 2018 brought in a very unique focus by specializing on bullying the people playing this game. In every round there is one bully and one bullying victim. The card combinations that need to be created have the goal to hit the chosen bullying victim.

—description from the publisher

Bagolytanoda is an educational board game for children between 8 and 10. It is supporting the studies of elementary school second, third and fourth classes, for Hungarian language and nature subjects. The game not only asks for existing knowledge but helps with teaching the basic material personalized for each single class. The game uses tile placement mechanism, and so the environment is variable while owls are discovering the surroundings. Questions are card-based, right answers worth gems, which may be spent on marketplaces, buying antique codexes.

—user summary

A Bagolytanoda egy oktató kvízjáték, ami az alsó tagozatos anyanyelvi és környezetismereti tananyagra épülve a legalapvetÅ‘bb tudnivalókat nem csupán kikérdezi, játékosan meg is tanítja.

A kérdéseket általános iskolai tanítók segítségével állítottuk össze, külön a második, a harmadik, és a negyedik osztályos tananyagot támogatva, így a játékosok az évfolyamuknak megfelelÅ‘en választhatnak a paklik közül. Helytállását szakmai szempontból a Tanítók Egyesületének ajánlása igazolja. A játék izgalmas felfedezÅ‘út is egyben, a gyerekek a játéktér önálló építésének köszönhetÅ‘en aktívan gyakorolják a számolást, az elÅ‘relátó tervezést és az erÅ‘forrásaikkal való gazdálkodást.

A játék során a gyerekek bagolyfiókák bÅ‘rébe bújnak, akik tanulmányi kirándulásra indulnak. A még ismeretlen terepet körrÅ‘l körre maguk építik, és drágaköveket gyÅ±jtenek, mindeközben feleletválasztós kérdésekre válaszolnak. Ha áldoznak rá plusz lépést, a könyvtárban akár meg is nézhetik, mi a soron következÅ‘ kérdés, így magabiztosan indulhatnak tovább gyÅ±jtögetni. Ha a játékosok elegendÅ‘ kincset gyÅ±jtöttek, felkereshetik a piacon kereskedÅ‘ bölcs baglyokat, akiktÅ‘l kódexeket vásárolhatnak. Az nyer, aki a legtöbb kódexet gyÅ±jti össze a játék során.

—description from the publisher

Socianimals is a card game about animals and families. The main goal of the game is to collect as many animals of the same family as you can. The more animals in the same family you collect the more points you score.
Every player starts with 5 cards in its hand. Every turn a player takes a card from a covered common deck (thus reaching 6 cards in hand) and then must play a card.

Once a card (an animal) is on the table another player can take it only if he has an animal of the same family. Once a player take a couple of animals from the same family those 2 cards must be put covered near the player who took them and they are part of his/her deck points.

Special cards can be played to steal/block/protect animals family(a couple or more couple of the same family).

—description from the designer

SUMMARY

Egyptians love cats, especially Cleopatra. When she ruled Egypt, she commissioned cat rescuers to protect cats, and royal cat inspectors to report and reward rescuers. In her time, cats were napping happily and safely in the sun throughout Egypt.

GOAL

In this game, the players are Egyptian cat rescuers, and their goal is to save cats in pyramids. A player receives 1 point for every unique cat rescued, plus 1 point per helper on the scoring tiles. When a player has scored 23 or more points, the game continues until the end of the current round. The player with the most points wins the game.

COMPONENTS

Rescuer meeple x 12 (Three for each player)
Score token x 4 (One for each player)
Cat pyramid tile x 13 (Three of each color, plus Cleocatra)
Royal Inspector token x 3 (brown)
Score track x 1
Rules

—description from the designer

In this prison, it isn't very complicated: the prisoners try to escape, and the guards try to stop them. Whether you find yourself playing the role of a prisoner or a guard, do the best you can.

The game is played in several round, continuing until one player (or more) achieves a score of 4 points.

Each round will be dealt a secret roles, and a hand of card. You play those card to help, or not in an escape routes. Cards have to be alternately placed face up / face down with the first card played on the route determining the order.

At the end of a round, each player will secretly select one route.
Then we reveal each card of each route, if the total number exceed the route demand and no gard is here, then the prisoners on this route escape and score one point each.
If any gard or if the total is lower, no escape, no point.
If no prisoner at all escapes, then each gard score 1 point.
New round...

This is one of several themed Go Fish/Quartet variants published by K. Hjelm Förlag around the 2000s. The subject is the 25 Swedish provinces, each set of four cards consisting of: one showing the province on a map of Sweden, also listing significant towns, lakes and rivers; one showing the coat of arms; one showing the province animal; and one showing the province plant. A special bonus card shows the coat of arms of Stockholm.

Each player gets an initial hand of seven cards. Gameplay proceeds as normal for Go Fish, with players demanding cards from each other and drawing from the talon, setting any completed sets aside. Bonus points are given for scoring many sets from any of the three major regional divisions, and for drawing the Stockholm card.

There is no maximum number of players stated, but the deck size will support a deal to 14 players.

—user summary

As the harvest approaches, the villagers gather and ponder the coming winter. Among them, darkness lurks, corrupting the town and its inhabitants. Unlikely allies will rise to either save this village or condemn it.

Can you make it through the lengthening nights and save the town? Or is something creeping up on you, disguised as a neighbor, waiting for its chance to BITE?

BITE is a social deduction game with secret roles for social gatherings. Players receive roles and pair up for a few minutes of conversation at a time, at the end of which each reveals an action card to the other player. They resolve these cards and move on to the next discussion, their motives changing throughout the game based upon which side they find themselves: Good or Evil. By the final night, either darkness will have been rooted out of the town, or it will have triumphed.

Each role has action cards associated with it that reveal information about their conversation partner, protect them from harm, convert them to their side, or kill them off in various ways. The roles are themed to a gothic fantasy setting including Witches, Hunters, Villagers, Occultists, Vampires and the like.

—description from the designer

“I mean to destroy the English and leave not one upon our lands.”  Pontiac  “It is not in the Indian’s power to affect anything of consequence.” Major Gladwin.

Pontiac’s War 1763-1766 followed on the heels of the French and Indian War which ended in 1763. Thanks to Indian resentment over the French surrender of their lands and the harsh policies of General Jeffery Amherst, governor-general of British North America, 20+ Indian nations rose up under the charismatic leadership of the Ottawa sachem, Pontiac and the Lenape Holy Man, Neolin. Pontiac’s War attempts to recreate the reaction of Indian leaders to British mishandling of frontier politics and the impending colonial crisis it presaged. Building on the point-to-point system and loose Indian alliances used in King Philip's War, this design expands frontier conflict using Battle cards to introduce combat chaos, British expenditure on troops, Uncertain Indian Arms supply, siege rules, the capture of prisoners, French interference and trader influence.

The game offers five short introductory scenarios (15-30 minutes), three one-year campaign scenarios (2 hours), and one three-year grand campaign (5-6 hours). Although not a solitaire design, it is solitaire friendly. Components included a mounuted game map and large, 338 3/4" size punch-out counters.

Game Information:

Complexity: 4 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 5 out of 10
Time Scale: Seasonal turns (approx. 3 months per turn)
Map Scale: Point-to-Point map (approx. 60-75 miles between points)
Unit Scale: 30-50 men, 4-6 artillery guns, individual officers and sea vessels

—description from the publisher

In Canvas, you play as a painter competing in an art competition. Players will collect art cards, layering 3 of them together to create their own unique Painting. Each card contains a piece of artwork as well as a set of icons used during scoring. Icons will be revealed or hidden based on the way players choose to layer the cards making for an exciting puzzle. Paintings are scored based on a set of Scoring cards which will change each game. Once players have created and scored 3 paintings the game ends.

On your turn you may take an Art card or make a painting. Art cards are selected from a row of cards in the center of play. Each of these cards has a cost associated with their position. After selecting an Art card you must pay its cost by placing an Inspiration token on each of the cards to its left. If you do not have enough Inspiration tokens, you may not select that card. Any tokens on the card you have selected are kept for future turns. The far left card costs no Inspiration tokens to take.

If you have three or more Art cards you may choose to make a painting. Select 3 of your art cards, arrange them in any order and then score them by comparing the visible icons on your painting to the Scoring conditions.

Once all players have made 3 paintings the game ends.

The player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

In 1680, on a small Caribbean island: Martinique
The rich settlers, the enriched buccaneers and even the religious orders lured by the hope of huge profits built many Habitations, these farms, true pre-industrial establishments technologically far ahead of their time, who not only exploited vast sugarcane fields but also slaves.

The game shows us to understand the economic complexity and the consequences of social injustices by testifing the daily life of such a Habitation, a strictly hierarchical microcosm, a dehumanized society where the thirst for freedom coexists with the thirst for profit

In Habitation sucrerie the players play a neutral role as observant but nonetheless active minds which can influence both  objectives of the Békés (Habitation masters) and the slaves, by an alternative asymmetrical game system mixing worker placement, aera control, hand management and exploration.


To win, players will have to control together the pawns of both sides and after 9 periods capitalize the most victory points in each of the two sides.

For the newest edition of Hanabi yet, expect a redesign, card stands, and three expansions included

• Avalanche of colors (10 multicolored cards)
• Black powder (10 black cards)
• 5 flamboyants (6 bonus tiles and a player sheet)

Hanabi—named for the Japanese word for "fireworks"—is a cooperative game in which players try to create the perfect fireworks show by placing the cards on the table in the right order. (In Japanese, hanabi is written as èŠ±ç«; these are the ideograms flower and fire, respectively.)

The card deck consists of five different colors of cards, numbered 1–5 in each color. For each color, the players try to place a row in the correct order from 1–5. Sounds easy, right? Well, not quite, as in this game you hold your cards so that they're visible only to other players. To assist other players in playing a card, you must give them hints regarding the numbers or the colors of their cards. Players must act as a team to avoid errors and to finish the fireworks display before they run out of cards.

An extra suit of cards, rainbow colored, is also provided for advanced or variant play.

It is a simple game for children based on association. Every player has to find cards of dinosaurs and coloured food of same colors. When it happens it is possible to take a coloured piece of dinosaurs to build it. First player who have a complete coloured dinosaur will win.

It is a dexterity game for very little children's. Some balls are placed in a bowl and then suddenly they come out. Each player has a dog-shaped glass and has to collect meatballs. At the start of the round, a draw done between different cards to decide the rule. you can get more meatballs, collect meatball sets or bet on in certain colors.

Start with an impenetrable prison swarming with Nastian warriors… stir in a captured princess, heir to the Laylian Empire and all its riches… add a dash of insane alien monsters who want to blow the place to smithereens… and all it takes is the craziest security detail in the Solar Hanseatic League to bring it all to a rolling boil! The result is a recipe for excitement, adventure, and suspense prepared just for you by the proven team of designer Fred Manzo and developer Hermann Luttmann.

Escape From Hades is a solitaire science-fiction extravaganza! It's a race against time as you make an opposed landing on the prison's surface, destroy its defenses, shimmy in through the maintenance shafts, fight your way to the princess, then fight your way back out again, all while your ship fights for its mechanical life against squadrons of enemy fighters and surface defenses. Played on two "wraparound" hex maps representing the exterior and interior of a cylindrical prison, this is a unique, challenging, and replayable experience filled with memorable moments and characters, all brought to life by the gorgeous and colorful art of Wil Alambre.

—description from the publisher

After a war that almost destroyed the Earth, seven powerful factions, the so-called Regent Houses, now control the Earth and share their rule according to what is known as the Treaty. It is an almost perfect balance of power, since no House has enough strength to claim the throne they share by itself ... Until now.

One of the Regent Houses, the Envers House, has discovered how to travel to the distant worlds of the universe. And with those new worlds at their disposal to dominate and gain Power, all Houses seek to grow enough to claim the title of Earth Emperor.

In Rise of an Emperor: Worlds in Conflict, each player chooses one of the seven Regent Houses (each has 10 personalized cards) and two of the different paths that exist in the world of RoaE to gain power. Each of them (Science, Religion, Economy, Politics, Subterfuge, Military and Exploration) adds 20 more cards to build its initial deck. In addition, each House has three Counselors that can be used on the Council Board.

Players use cards for actions like increasing their House skills, raising their military and technological levels, building buildings, playing the characters of their House ...

The large number of cards in the game (770) allows a great variety of actions. You can make and break alliances with other races and civilizations, send assassins against your rivals, or spy on them to know what they hide. You can try to make your ruler a living God or be the richest House in the Universe. You can find alien artifacts, other races and friendly or hostile civilizations, worlds and moons, powerful strategic resources, build buildings such as the Academy of War or the Intelligence Center and an endless number of other options ...

Each House has a personal board to develop their civilization, and to do so many of the cards must be built before they can be used ... but both space and resources are limited.

In addition, there is the ubiquitous Treaty, which limits the Houses' actions. Many of the actions in the game are illegal ones. So in order to avoid the punishment we must cover them up or legalize them ... or maybe another House can catch us in fraganti !!!

Rise of an Emperor is a Civilizations 4x game, which uses mechanics like worker placement, hand and resource management, and hidden information management. Each game is different and the multiple combinations of customization make it highly replayable.

—description from the publisher

Tiny gophers are rushing headlong to reach the surface before the water floods their burrows. The only escape is through some old feed holes filled up by the wind with drifting dust and litter. But there are still some remnants of the things they once hoarded there, such as acorns and berries and other stuff that might come in useful.

Underground Panic is a semi-cooperative game. Players join forces to rescue all the gophers by leading them through the tunnels before the water floods their dwelling, trying to gather as many foodstuff as possible during the flight. They can move any of the gophers in their turn, and collect items in their own cheek-poaches. The game ends when all the gophers have escaped from the burrow. Players are rewarded for speed, but the game is continued until there are any gophers under the ground. The player who collects the most victory points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Jön a víz! Menekülni kell! Az apró kis ürgék a kijárat felé igyekeznek, de sajnos a szél mindenféle szemetet behordott a járatokon keresztül az ürgelyukakba. Azonban van itt nem kevés élelem, makk és bogyó, valamint más hasznos dolog is, amiket az ürgék valamikor régen itt elraktároztak.

A játék célja, hogy együttes erÅ‘vel minden ürgét szabadítsatok ki a járatokon keresztül, még mielÅ‘tt elönti az ürgelyukakat a víz, és eközben minél több pontot hozó terményt gyÅ±jtsetek össze. Nincs saját figurátok; amikor rátok kerül a sor, bármelyik ürgével léphettek. A játék akkor ér véget, amikor minden ürgének sikerül kijutni az ürgejáratból. Azonban nem feltétlenül az a játékos nyer, akinek ez elsÅ‘ként sikerül! A gyorsaságáért jutalom jár, de a játék mindaddig tart, amíg van ürge a odalent. A gyÅ‘ztes az lesz, aki a legtöbb pontot gyÅ±jtötte össze.

—description from the publisher (Hungarian)

World War Africa: The Congo 1998-2001 is a wargame simulation of the 2nd war fought over the Congo by two coalitions of African countries during the late 20th and early 21st centuries. The consequences of these two wars are still felt today.

In the war of 1996-97, the corrupt regime of Joseph Mobutu was overthrown by a coalition of East African countries led by Rwanda. The country formerly known as Zaire was renamed Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), and Mobutu was replaced by another Cold War era dinosaur, Laurent Kabila, at the helm of the huge, mineral-rich African country. One year later, however, Kabila’s sponsors, particularly Rwanda were not pleased. A number of issues including; the expulsion of Rwandan advisers from the DRC, Kabila recruiting Hutu combatants who had fled Rwanda, and the discrimination suffered by ethnic Tutsi in eastern DRC, moved Rwanda to try to remove Kabila from power. Supported by Uganda, Congolese rebels and the Tutsi minority in DRC, the Rwandans expected to win an easy victory, just as the year before. Kabila, however, was quickly supported by expeditionary forces of Zimbabwe and Angola, among other African countries, so overthrowing him turned out much harder than expected. The resulting conflict would involve about a dozen African countries, and cost the lives of an estimated 5 million people, thus earning the name of “World War Africa”, or “The Great African War”.

Each hex on the map represents 100 kilometers from side to side. Each turn of play represents from one to three months, with 13 game turns (GT) covering the period from August 1998 to June 2001. Ground units represent brigade, regiment and battalion sized formations. The combat aircraft units represent various numbers of sorties needed to accomplish missions over the time-frame of a turn.

—description from the designer


Published with Modern War #52

Lost amidst the surreal and bizarre unknowns of the far reaches of the cosmos, your crew of explorers must pull together to discover the resources necessary to survive the long journey home.

Unsettled is a 2-4 player cooperative survival adventure set in the wondrous and unnerving fringes of uncharted space. There are no enemies and no combat, only an environment where every step, every breath, every particle around you could mean immediate, terrifying, death. Enemies are the least of your concerns.

In these incredible conditions you must complete a series of tasks necessary to your continued survival. Perhaps the water reclamation system on the ship needs repair, or (as usual) food supplies are running low. Before you lies a strange alien landscape - it’s up to you to complete these tasks using…whatever you find out there.

Each time you play you will have a different combination of survival tasks to complete and the things you discover (and their weird properties) will be different as well. So while you always start out knowing what problems you need to solve you have no idea how you’re going to use the world before you to do so (or what the world is going to do to you while you try).

As you explore the environment, encountering wild & unique opportunities along the way, you will work closely with the rest of your crew to achieve your goal of continued existence. The only thing you can be sure of is each other; lose that trust and you’ll lose all hope of survival.

—description from the designer

This core set comes with 2 planets, Planet 001-Wenora and Planet 002-Grakkis, which are not available individually.

Embrace your fungal hosts and discover mind-bending abilities beyond your imagination or be absorbed forever. Unsettled: Wenora is the 1st planet box for "Unsettled".

Wenora is a bizarre and wondrous fungal jungle teeming with alien vegetation and gargantuan spore-based lifeforms.

Growth in this place is of a scale beyond any we've encountered. Life drips and pulsates disturbingly, mysterious pastes and powders covering most of the planet's crawling surfaces. Simply traversing the land is deeply unnerving, yet awe inspiring all the same. Tentacles, toxic spores and an alarming array of suction cups abound.

Things you may find here:

     Electromagnetic Polypores
     Incandescent Slime
     Floating Tentacle Knots
     Screaming Glow Frogs
     Telekinetic Microbe Clouds


Discover pathways to the skies to escape violent storms and enormous creatures that haunt the surface. Unsettled: Grakkis is the 2nd planet box for "Unsettled".

Grakkis is a sand-swept desert ruins. What was once a massive planet-wide forest of unfathomably large trees is now that forest's graveyard - all the trees having long since petrified to a stone-like state. Some have crumbled into interesting formations. Some had rotted before petrifying, creating strange caves and crevices, many of them thousands of feet above ground. Colossal alien lifeforms, disturbing in their appearance, wander the wasteland. They tower horrifyingly in the distance like gods in some waking existential nightmare.

Things you may find here:

     Musical Stonewood Formation
     Falling Stone-Fruit Bombs
     Bioluminescent Paste
     Blooming Geodes
     Gaseous Sand Storms

Game is inspired by "Vanamehe multikas" animated shorts and the feature film. Vanamees ("Old man") is a local hero loved by people, who always gets involved into humorous and absurd adventures with both his grandchildren and local villagers alike. He is wise and good-looking just like you. The same goes about his relatives, rivals, acquaintances and other animals. Time, milk and other stuff will fly convivially when playing together!

GOAL OF THE GAME is to collect as many task cards as possible.

GAME-PLAY

     Lead player spins the bottle. The one the bottle appoints is the new lead player. 
     Lead player takes a topmost task card and reads the task of same color than the colored die in the bottle. In case the die shows white, lead player can pick the color without reading the task first.
     According to the task card, someone: gets the card and places it in front of them face down;  gets assignment and places it in front of them face up; looses a card and gives it to another player.
     Game ends when the draw pile is emptied. Player with the most cards in front of them wins the game.

In this card game 3 assistants "Käpt'n Quizzo" (KQ), "Reno Retter" (RR) and "Helli Helfer" (HH) guide through one of 3 different game modes.

Knowledge: Learn about rescue systems specified on 26 different cards with RR.

Trivia game: All players answer KQs questions and score victory points. KQ announces the winner at the end of the game.

Card Game with HH

For all games the Tiptoi pen is required.
The Cards can be combined with any of other Game of Wissen & Quizzen Series for more variety of trivia themes.

Dominant Reign brings forth the future where Earth has finally united to face the universe together.  As they attain faster than light travel they encounter the Star Elders, a powerful alien race that seeks to keep the peace between the universe's inhabitants from infringing on each others borders. The real threat, the Blight, continues to grow and the universe must face them together.

This non-collectible stand-alone pick-up game is based in a sci-fi universe with four factions; the Earth Expanse, the Star Elders, the Neutral Zone, and the Blight.  Select your allegiance at the beginning of the game, stage the playing field, change your loyalties, and bluff your way to victory.

Claim your faction, dominate the universe!

—description from the publisher
